fullText:
Samm-Art Williams passed away last month at age 78, and one of the sad ironies of his death is that he didn’t live to see Tory Kittles’ powerful performance in “Home.”

Williams’ 1979 play received its first Broadway revival on Wednesday at Roundabout’s Todd Haimes Theatre; it last appeared on the Big Boards back in 1980 after its world premiere the previous year at the Negro Ensemble Company.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This appears to be just the opening paragraph providing background information about the playwright's death and production history, with no critical evaluation of the show; openai: The text provided is an introductory paragraph mentioning the playwright's death and the play's revival, without any evaluative content or review of the current production.; gemini: This is an obituary and background information on the play, not a review of the current production.
